metadata.name: WWCD - What Would Citadel Do
metadata.description: Understand market maker behavior to trade with them, not against them
metadata.philosophy: Don't fight the market makers - draft behind them

core_principle.statement: Market makers are PREDICTABLE at key levels
core_principle.why: They MUST provide liquidity - this creates patterns
core_principle.our_edge: Wait for them to act, then follow their move

profitable_activities: Hunt stop losses (trigger retail stops, then reverse)
Fade retail (take opposite side of retail sentiment)
Front-run large orders (see order flow, position ahead)

stop_hunt_awareness.description: MMs hunt stops at obvious levels to create liquidity
levels_to_watch: Swing highs/lows visible on any chart

our_response.wait: Don't have stops at obvious levels
our_response.watch: Wait for the spike and reversal
our_response.enter: Enter with MMs after stops are cleared

retail_sentiment_fade.description: When retail is heavily positioned one way, MMs take the other side
signals_retail_is_wrong: High social media mentions (bullish tweets = sell)

our_response.contrarian: Fade retail after MMs trigger their stops
our_response.timing: Wait for the stop hunt, then enter

order_flow_defense.description: MMs see order flow before execution - defend yourself

our_defense.mental_stops: Use mental stops, not visible ones
our_defense.iceberg_approach: Multiple small positions, not one large

second_mover_advantage.description: Let MMs show their hand, then follow
second_mover_advantage.principle: The second mover in poker often wins

execution.ride: Stay with the move until next key level

best_times_to_trade.reason: After Asian session stop hunt, fresh move begins
After London stop hunt, US institutions enter
After initial spike/retail panic, real move begins
Institutions often enter on the hour, set up early

mm_accumulation: Volume building on test of level

our_advantages_vs_citadel.small_size: We can get fills they can't

rules_for_neo: NEVER have stops at obvious levels
ALWAYS wait for the stop hunt to complete
NEVER chase a move - let it come to you
ALWAYS know where retail stops are clustered
NEVER fight a strong trend - MMs can extend it
ALWAYS have a smaller size than you think you need
